item.title: GoBot: Modular Hardware, Variable Autonomy, Promoting Physical Activity
Make your own mad libs with ChatGPT
item.description: App to create your own mad libs or use ChatGPT to generate them.

item.title: Thermal Imaging
item.description: Gauging child affect through thermal imaging.

item.title: Gardening Automation
item.description: Sensing and Automation of Plant Watering.

item.title: Behavior Trees for Child-Robot Interaction
item.description: Behavior Trees for Robot Control and Child Behavior Modeling.

item.title: Clinician Perspectives on Autonomy and Trust in Robots for Pediatric Interventions
item.description: Describes a study where pediatric clinicians were interviewed regarding their opinions about using assistive robots and levels of autonomy for robots interacting with their patients.

item.title: GoBot Go! Using a Custom Assistive Robot to Promote Physical Activity in Children
item.description: Describes the expanded results of a study where GoBot interacted with 8 children over two months of weekly sessions and showed how the robot improved the children's physical activity levels.

item.title: Pilot Observations of an Autonomous Red Light, Green Light Robot for Interactions with Children with Disabilities
item.description: Describes the design and initial testing of the red light, green light mode for GoBot.

item.title: Robottheory Fitness: GoBotâ€™s Engagement Edge for Spurring Physical Activity in Young Children
item.description: Describes the results of a study where GoBot interacted with 8 children over two months of weekly sessions and showed how the robot improved the children's physical activity levels.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of Movement: A Body-Weight Support System & Assistive Robot Case Study
item.description: Describes the case study conducted with GoBot, Shelbytron, and the Body-Weight-Support-Harness.

item.title: A Model Child? Behavior Models for Simulated Infant-Robot Interaction
item.description: Describes the design and initial evaluation of a simulator that models infant behavior through an annotation method that evaluates infant attention in real-world studies.

item.title: Let Them Have Bubbles! Filling Gaps in Toy-Like Behaviors for Child-Robot Interaction
item.description: Describes a review of Fisher-Price toys for developmental capabilities and an analysis of an initial child-robot interaction study.

item.title: Epic Experience
item.description:
Certifications

Beaker Clinical Pathology 2024

Clarity Data Model 2024

Epic Resume
  • Resume

Experience

Currently working as a systems analyst III for Lakeland Regional Health supporting both Epic and Cerner.

Prior work with Beaker Anatomic Pathology, Bridges Interfaces, Order Transmittal, charging, microbiology, and Cytogenetics and Molecular Diagnostics.

Former Epic Technical Services rep and Boost consultant.

Customers worked with

  • Lakeland Regional Health (2024 - Present)
  • Virtua Health (2018)
  • CHI (2017 - 2018)
  • Yale New Haven Health (2016 - 2017)
  • UCLA Health (2015 - 2016)
  • Cambridge Hospitals NHS (2014 - 2015)
  • Jurong Hospital (2014)
  • Northwest Community Hospital (2014)
  • Baptist Memorial Health (2013 - 2014)
